sentence: Madam Speaker, I rise to sound the alarm about the Trump  administration's reported plans to fire nearly 7,000 workers in the  U.S.
title: Illegal Firings Could Devastate Oregon

sentence: We know how important this  is, the Flight 5342 passenger families, the Lilley family, along with  myself and Senator Cruz, have been trying to sound the alarm bells  around the Capitol in the airspace about why we shouldn't let the  military fly without this important broadcast system, so that people  know when they are in the region and can translate that communication,  so that air traffic controllers and other aircraft in a busy airspace  know when the military is there.
title: National Defense Authorization Act

sentence: Texans are paying attention, and I am here to sound the alarm on this  outrageous bill.
title: Republican Budget Bill

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to sound the alarm  on a crisis threatening our democracy.
title: Recognizing Jessica Suarez Nieto During Teacher Appreciation Week

sentence: President, I am here to sound the alarm--to make  my colleagues aware--of the crisis that faces us.
Senator Padilla is right to sound the alarm about this,  and I am proud to join him.
title: Terminating the National Emergency Declared to Impose Global Tariffs

sentence: President, I rise today to sound the alarm about  what is happening to our Nation's ability to advance lifesaving medical  research in the first month of the Trump administration.
title: National Institutes of Health

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to sound the alarm across Ohio.
title: Funding Manufacturing Extension Partnership Offices

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to sound the alarm on the  impending closure of the Quartz Hill Post Office and who knows how many  other contract postal units across the country.
title: Closure of Quartz Hill Post Office

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to sound the alarm that our democratic  values and the rule of law are under attack.
title: Attacks and Threats on Democracy and Rule of Law

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to sound the alarm on the  military buildup in the Caribbean, edging us closer to a regime-change  war in Venezuela.
title: We Don't Need Another Regime-Change War

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to sound the alarm for our  Republic and our Constitution.
title: Venezuelan Strikes and Congressional War Powers

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to sound the alarm that  sensitive data for millions of Americans is at risk.
title: Protecting Sensitive Data for Millions of Americans

sentence: Today, I am beginning an extended effort to elevate this issue and  sound the alarm--because voters will go to the polls this Tuesday, and  my fear is that it could be the last free and fair election, unless we  rise up and we act.
title: Terminating the National Emergency Declared to Impose Duties on Articles Imported From Canada

sentence: President, before we broke for the August recess, I  came to the Senate floor to sound the alarm on our rising national debt  and unsustainable fiscal trajectory.
title: Cloture Motion

sentence: They fired the  auditors and inspectors so no one is there to sound the alarm when Musk  steers contracts to his own companies.
